It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in countries like South Africa, Namibia, and Botswana. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Freylinia decurrens is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
